intro: Alyxia sarasinii, commonly known as the Sarasin's alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a leathery texture. Alyxia sarasinii is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat, with features that help it conserve water.
